channel.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
channel.description:
Hi all. I have a BAD case of the perfectionisms. At the moment in Auxy I have about 4 finished songs, for most people my standard GOOD ENOUGH TO RELEASE but not for me. I have been working on Tides, Febrero, Claustrophobia and No.1 (it has no name yet) for over a month at least. One of them for 3 months. I always think to myself "I SHOULD GET THESE PUBLISHED MR MOOO YOU IDIOT JUST PUBLISH THESE [spoiler]and you music is trash[/spoiler]" but I never do. I guess I'm worried that when I upload it I'll get 50 comments saying 'oh this is so bad you could've improved this' and 'meh it's ok it would be so much better if you improved this'.
That's just the finished songs.
I have over 100 songs that I could make into full tracks and I just never do. I just can't move forward on them until I _perfect_ the beginning of the song. And for me that just never happens.
Please, I repeat, _please_ help me. I haven't uploaded a normal, non-remix or collab single (Enero doesn't count because I had a time limit to upload that, end of January) since Invigorate, 2 months ago. This case of the perfectionisms could ruin my Soundcloud. I have had 32 plays in the last week, because I have so little new content.
I need help.
- Mr Mooo :smile: :grin:

item.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
item.dc:creator: Mr_Mooo
item.description:
Great Idea! I’ll do that now

item.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Why not stick them up on SC as Private, stick ‘(Draft)’ in the name and then share them in the WIP category?

The feedback might help you hone in on what’s not quite right, if anything, and break the inner stalemate.

Read full topic
item.source: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms

item.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
item.dc:creator: Mr_Mooo
item.description:
A general feeling they’re not ‘ready’.

I love using punctuation and symbols so my projects move to the top of my project list
It’s so useful

Read full topic
item.source: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms

item.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Do you know specifically what’s missing/not quite right for each track, or is it a general feeling that they’re not ‘ready’ that you’re having trouble shaking off?

 
Btw, I like the notation in the name.

I use !/!!/!!! to show how close any tracks being actively developed are to completion.

Read full topic

item.description:
I uploaded tides which is good but…,


All of these are publish worthy and I am in the same spot again.

item.description:
Believe me, Im the same. I spend usually about 3 months for every song I ever make.

Soooooooo yes I know how you feel.

item.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Fwiw™…

LANDR Blog: 5 Signs Perfectionism is Ruining Your Music And How to Fix It

LANDR Blog: How I Got Over The Fear Of Sharing My First Track
(Not your first track, but still some valuable points in this article.)

Read full topic
item.source: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms

item.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
item.dc:creator: Matik
item.description:
I’ve had times where I’ve looked back at a song and said to myself “Why did I think this was a good song”.
It’s not the fact that you’re convincing youself that your music is bad, it’s the fact that you’ve improved enough to realise your own mistakes. What that being the case, if you upload a track and realise you could of done more on it, then that means you’ve gotten better at making music in general and for you to make a song completely perfect may not happen because there’s always room for improvement.

I’m just babbling on now, but don’t forget that whatever you do, we’ll be there to support and give feedback on your tracks

Read full topic
item.source: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms

item.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
item.dc:creator: Xiejra
item.description:
A song or piece of art work is never ever finished. It is only finished when you decide it is finished, not everyone else decides that.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
An author will always want to edit their work, you release it unto the world when you are ready to leave it alone and want to move on.

item.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Shepdoge:

Big names had to start somewhere; they probably released music under aliases such as ours in forums like Disco.

Read full topic
item.source: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms

item.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
item.dc:creator: Shepdoge
item.description:
Just a word of advice (which is perhaps a little hypocritical seeing as though I release quite infrequently also)

Mr_Mooo:

I guess I’m worried that when I upload it I’ll get 50 comments saying ‘oh this is so bad you could’ve improved this’ and ‘meh it’s ok it would be so much better if you improved this’.

You gotta remember though: feedback, especially when it’s constructive, is so much more valuable than likes. Wanting to become popular without confidence in your product isn’t going to work. By putting yourself out there, you may cop nasty comments from time to time, but you will also gain a lot more knowledge than just keeping your music unreleased, which will skyrocket your confidence in later musical endeavours. Big names had to start somewhere; they probably released music under aliases such as ours in forums like Disco. ️

Read full topic
item.source: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms

item.title: A VERY Bad Case Of The Perfectionisms
item.dc:creator: MrSerpent
item.description:
I’ll be there to help you if you need any feedback or other improvement suggestions
